alert.note: Alert for Perry (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 09 at 2:17AM CDT until June 14 at 4:36AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Arkansas... Fourche Lafave River Near Houston affecting Perry County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Fourche Lafave River Near Houston. * WHEN...From early this morning to early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Agricultural lands along the Arkansas River and up into the Fourche LaFave begin to flood. Equipment and livestock should be moved to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 25.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 27.3 feet by Thursday evening. It will then fall briefly to 26.3 feet by Friday evening and begin rising again late Friday night. It will rise to 26.6 feet early Saturday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 1 AM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Crest Time Date Fourche Lafave R Houston 25.0 25.9 Thu 1 AM 27.3 26.4 26.3 27.3 7 PM 6/09 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
